result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Fahey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Fahey not in court.  Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler appeared by video for Matthew Fahey.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant's family has retained Attorney Kuchler. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Young notified the court that she is unable to appear due to the SPD conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 30, parties notified.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON Wednesday, October 12, 2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Matthew Fahey in court. Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30, in Room 622 in the Courthouse.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20,right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. The case is scheduled for a Pretrial Conference in Br 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with MB; MB; EL.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/10/22 @ 2p
